title: Yesterday the Server crash....
body: I would like my 10 points back from a forced (second) dodge. I dodged one game (and rightfully lost 3 points), the second game however was a forced dodge from your servers going down. Please return my points. Thanks.

replies.body:
*Loss prevention*, the feature that prevents loss of matches and the like during a period of massive server instability cannot be retroactively applied to specific games. Once the server records a loss, win, or LP gain/loss, they cannot be modified. The system is designed this way to prevent abuse. 

If you encounter any technical issues that cause you to disconnect from a match or queue, please let me know and I'll gladly assist you further. Let me know if you have any questions.

We were in champ select when the server went down. Since I was the one up to pick I lost 10LP (2nd dodge for that day) because the server crashed. I'm simply asking for my points back. I didn't DC... we all sat and chatted for about 5 minutes before everyone was kicked out. When I tried to log back in I got the "server down" message.

Yesterday, I was in a ranked game when the server had crashed. Since it was already passed the remake time limit we were unable to cancel the game, which resulted in many players disconnecting in the middle of lane, at base or not even connecting at all. The result was an unfair game in which the other team was awarded by faults of the server rather than through proper gameplay. Hopefully at Riot you are reasonable to reimburse for the lost LP through leaverbuster. Although it was not Riot's fault directly, I hope that they can fix the problems that were made rather than ignoring the server failure completely.
